text: Gesta Danorum (Deeds of the Danes) is a chronicle of Danish history. It was written by the 12th century historian Saxo Grammaticus. This work is the most significant for the Danish nation's early history. Gesta Danorum consists of sixteen books written in Latin. Category:History books Category:Norse mythology Category:12th century in Europe Category:Danish culture Category:12th-century books
title: Gesta Danorum
